text:
330ml bottle 13th Anniversary version bought at LY Drinks & Bitess booth at HKCEC in Wan Chai during HKTDC Food Expo 2016.
Looks: Clear light golden colour; One quarter finger head with soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Good sticky lacing with notable slight carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant full lager malt, with strong apple, pears, strong floral, bread, light lemon and grass. 

Taste: Mid to light sweet fair lager malt, with strong floral, fair molasses, biscuits, light lemon, mid to light bitter hops and fresh grass.

Body: Mid to light body. Slick and crisp palate.

Mouth Feel: Good lager maltyness in a slightly thinned but smooth background. Clean and dry with strong floral and light sweetness. Biscuity and hoppy with light lemon to round. Breezy and nice!

Hoppiness: Strong floral, light lemon and grass in nose and taste; Bitterness is fair to medium for an abrupt, mid to light astringent malty finish.

After Taste: Dry. Flowery and fairly bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one is very malty in a well-attenuated body, with nice fruity ester aroma and flowery. Clean, easy and strongly hoppy. This brewer really knows their German styles and do it well. A joy!

13th Anniversary version. Lovely floury malty aroma, light grassy and herbal hoppiness. Taste is good. Light bittereness, high on the maltiness, guess thats the unfiltered aspect maybe. Little bit of hops at the end. Very quaffable indeed.

13th anniversary bottle from Tanakaya. Light mikan and floral notes on the nose but they dissipate after a few minutes. Clean and crisp on the palate. Light bitterness and crisp and refreshing carbonation. Quite delicious on a hot day and seems to brewed well to style. Quite enjoyable.

Pours quite clear, whitish golden with a decent head. Aroma is simple grainy, at first I was getting some orange but it faded. Taste is relatively light, some fruitiness in there, light, crisp and refreshing. I think its a good kolsch, not really that special as a beer but as for this style, pretty good.

Bottle shared at GBBF 2015, day 2 - London. Thanks to Phil (KansaiBeerLvrs)! Pours clear yellow with a frothy white head. The aroma has dry cereal and straw. Light sweet flavor with some dried cereal, mild dough, faintly bitter straw - little else. Light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Moderately clean on the finish, with more dominant pale cereal character. A simple kolsch. Fine.

12th August 2015GBBF Day 2. Bottle share. Thanks to Phil (Kansaibeerlvrs) for hauling this one over. Light haze pale gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Smooth palate, semi dry. Decent fine carbonation. Smooth malts, some cream. Little herby something. Smooth finish. Inoffensive.
Bottle at GBBF. Thanks to someone! Pale yellow, thin head. Tastes like a trad Kolsch and drinks like on. Decent

Bottle thanks to Phil shared at gbbf. Light hazed yellow straw coloured pour with a halo of white head. Aroma is light Apple, grainy, faint rubber. Flavour is grainy, light straw, tangy dried apple, straw, faint acid. Palate is airy carbonation, spritzy, finish is nice and dry.

10th Anniversary Colonia. Part of the Anniversary 3-pack from the brewery via Rakuten. The anniversary beer. 5% super clear gold with a fast disappearing head. No real aroma. A crisp lager/pilsner body with minor hay notes & a clean bitter finish. My buddy Tonys favorite of the 3 in the set. A pretty good lager. I am not a big lager guy but it is a top quality lager!

Now 9th anniversary. Still a kolsch. Soft wheat, hay and dandelion like quality to the nose. Some Euro hops too - a bit spicy. Smooth, rounded mouthfeel. More hay, dough and a soft bitter finish. Good summer drinking.

Draught at Q-Brick. Nice cloudy golden color with a low head. Pretty. Citrus hop aroma. Ruch, full malt, flavor, with honey and crackers, nice citrus hops. Medium bitterness. Very malty and full bodied for a Kolsch, yet refreshing and tasty, and still pretty authentic kolsch character. Good summer beer.
